SENT.plain: The availability of different semantic relations between mild anomic dysphasic and nondysphasic subjects was investigated using a picture description task
Results of the analyses revealed statistically nonsignificant differences between the two groups for the variables of total utterances and mean length of utterances
Of the different cases examined, a significant difference between the two groups of subjects was revealed in their use of the "other" case relation category
Also, within the dysphasic group maximum verbal paraphasias occurred for the object case
Discussion of the obtained results relate the selective availability of specific cases to the possible differences in linguistic coding between the two groups
Also, the interrelationship between quantity of verbal output and incidence of verbal paraphasia is discussed
